description: Chili crab is a seafood dish from Singapore, known for its sweet and savory sauce based on tomato and chili.
ingredients: [{"name": "cornstarch", "units": "tablespoon", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "peanut oil", "units": "tablespoons", "amount": "7"}, {"name": "minced shallots", "units": "cup", "amount": "0.5"}, {"name": "grated ginger", "units": "tablespoons", "amount": "3"}, {"name": "garlic", "units": "tablespoons", "amount": "3"}, {"name": "Thai Chilies", "units": "whole", "amount": "4"}, {"name": "Dungeness crab", "units": "whole", "amount": "2"}, {"name": "chicken broth", "units": "cups", "amount": "2"}, {"name": "tomato paste", "units": "cup", "amount": "0.25"}, {"name": "hot sweet chili sauce", "units": "cup", "amount": "0.5"}, {"name": "large egg", "units": "beaten", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "green onions", "units": "cup", "amount": "0.5"}, {"name": "Chinese parsley", "units": "cup", "amount": "1"}]
instructions: Step 1: In a small bowl, stir cornstarch with 2 tablespoons of water; set aside. In a large wok with a lid, heat oil over medium heat until simmering. Stir in shallots, ginger, garlic, and chilies. Cook until fragrant; stir about 1 minute. Step 2: Add the crab pieces and broth. Increase heat to medium-high and bring to a boil. Cover loosely and gently boil. Decrease heat if necessary until crab has turned red and is nearly cooked. Step 3: Remove cover and stir in tomato paste and chili sauce. Simmer 1 minute and season to taste with salt, sugar, or chili sauce. Stir in cornstarch and boil to thicken. Step 4: Remove from heat and stir in egg. Stir in green onions. Ladle into a serving dish, sprinkle with Chinese parsley. Then serve.
